body:
I wonder if it would be helpful to reframe this discussion and even the proposal in terms of new code being written? Such as the example at: https://github.com/golang/go/issues/16339#issuecomment-233786585

My assumption being that there will be more Go code written in the future than has been in the past, and that the reason for refactoring is to achieve some end (e.g. better modularity).

What would that ideal code look like?
